subject: Programming
title: Learned Helplessness in Code
description: A 60-second lesson on Learned Helplessness in Code.

hook.text: The legacy codebase is a disaster. Everyone says it can't be fixed. So nobody tries.

buildup.text: Learned helplessness occurs when repeated failure convinces people that improvement is impossible.

discovery.text: One small victory â€” fixing a single ugly module â€” can break the spell and restore confidence.

twist.text: The code isn't the real problem. The belief that it can't improve is. Mindset poisons before code does.

climax.text: Teams that celebrate small wins build momentum. Momentum defeats helplessness over time.

punchline.text: One small fix can break the cycle of despair.

quiz.question: What causes learned helplessness in development teams?
options: Repeated failure convincing people improvement is impossible
